page.title: 03Farm Machinery
page.content: Farmers use different machines in different seasons. In SPRING we need tractors for shifting food about to different fields, a muck spreader for fertilizing fields and a tractor to pull it, a plough to plough the fields ready for scattering seeds, and for that you would need a drill. In SUMMER you need a forager to cut the silage. Then you would need a bailer if you wanted to bail your silage. You would need a combine harvester to cut the hay or barley, then use the forager to pick up the barley or hay and a bailer to make it into bails, a crimper to pick up the grain. In AUTUMN you sow grass so you would need a rotator, a tractor and a drill. In WINTER you would need a tractor to take the food to the cattle.
